comment: Undid the second and third good-faith edits by 187.106.215.195, as less good formatting + diffuse essay-like sentence. Leaving the first edit as informative.

diff.*:
Line 2: Line 2:  
[[File:Ethics en.svg|200px|right|thumb|Ethics can be subdivided into four major branches.]]
 
[[File:Ethics en.svg|200px|right|thumb|Ethics can be subdivided into four major branches.]]
 
{{Philosophy sidebar}}
 
{{Philosophy sidebar}}
−
'''Ethics''', sometimes known as '''philosophical ethics''', '''ethical theory''', '''moral theory''', and '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending and recommending concepts of right and wrong [[action (philosophy)|conduct]], often addressing disputes of [[moral diversity]].<ref name="iep.utm.edu">http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/</ref> The term comes from the Greek word '''ἠθικός''' or ''[[ethos]]'', which means "character", "habit", "praxis". The superfield within philosophy known as [[axiology]] includes both ethics and [[aesthetics]] and is unified by each sub-branch's concern with value.<ref>''Random House Unabridged Dictionary'' [http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/axiology Entry on Axiology.]</ref> Philosophical ethics investigates what is the best way for humans to live, and what kinds of actions are right or wrong in particular circumstances. Its different from judge-made law and diferent too of moral.
+
'''Ethics''', sometimes known as '''philosophical ethics''', '''ethical theory''', '''moral theory''', and '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending and recommending concepts of right and wrong [[action (philosophy)|conduct]], often addressing disputes of [[moral diversity]].<ref name="iep.utm.edu">http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/</ref> The term comes from the Greek word ἠθικός or ''[[ethos]]'', which means "character", "habit", "praxis". The superfield within philosophy known as [[axiology]] includes both ethics and [[aesthetics]] and is unified by each sub-branch's concern with value.<ref>''Random House Unabridged Dictionary'' [http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/axiology Entry on Axiology.]</ref> Philosophical ethics investigates what is the best way for humans to live, and what kinds of actions are right or wrong in particular circumstances.
−
Ethics may be divided into four major areas of study:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
+
Ethics may be divided into four major areas of study:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
 
* [[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined;
 
* [[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined;
 
* [[Normative ethics]], about the practical means of determining a moral course of action;
 
* [[Normative ethics]], about the practical means of determining a moral course of action;
